column4: hey can anyone help me? i just installed ubuntu and when i try to start it up i hear a sound but my screen stay black.
that'll be something with the graphics that is causing an issue - do you know the graphics card?
that'll be something with the graphics that is causing an issue - do you know the graphics card? - like i asked earlier...
using the default driver?
it never let you in after you installed?
at the boot prompt you can press F1 and get boot options - iirc safe graphics is one of the options - does that boot?
worth a try
okay when my computer starts up  and i get to the boot menu i see ubuntu  ubuntu(recovery mode  2 memory test things and xp
sorry I was thinking of the live cd - I led you astray there
choose the recovery option - you can read the X log from there
that is what it does - then it gives a prompt like in the terminal - the you do   cat /var/log/Xorg.0.log | less
seems there is a major issue with that graphics card - I don't use nvidia so don't know what else to suggest - if the tty won't work...
i've had ubuntu installed on this computer before a while ago  its was an older version of ubuntu. it worked fune  maybe i should try installing an older version then updating?
it might be a kernel issue or something with the X driver I don't know - upgrading from an older distro will just get you to where you are now...
in    www.google.com/linux   search for your card number and ubuntu
i searched  "nvidia 6150 le ubuntu"  what sould i be looking for?
a link that mentions solved or anything similar
i dont see anything that says solved   try lookin thru the search yourself and see if anything there might help you help me
yep - I'm too busy to do your searches for you and read lots of web pages tho
okay, do you think that updating to the 10.10 rc would work?
I couldn't say - I don't know where the issue is and where it needs to be fixed
well, i cant think of another option so im gonna try.
good luck :]
thank you.
